content: opened by leaving it somewhere warm and dry for a couple of weeks if you want to make a sitting squirrel repeat round 6 two extra times to lengthen the tail and work four extra short row to extend each back leg then pin to dry in a sitting position once dry a few discrete stitches between the paws and underside and between the tail and the back help to hold the position secure you can give it a little metal acorn or cone charm to hold or a tiny real acorn this pattern was first published in the journal of scottish yarns issue 6 november 2025 you are very welcome to use this pattern for personal teaching or charity purposes please credit woollen wave if you do red squirrel brooch pattern version 1 1 november 2025 by woollen wave woollenwave@gmail com / https // www woollenwave co uk / @woollen_wave
